title: Jimmy Carter National Historic Site: Physical / Mobility
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Accessibility     Physical / Mobility              Physical / Mobility       The Jimmy Carter National Historic Site is wheelchair accessible. The park has a wheelchair for visitors to use while they are visiting the Plains High School Visitor Center and Museum. The park also provides a motorized scooter and a golf cart located at the Boyhood Farm for visitors to use during their visit. The golf cart can be used with the assistance of a park ranger during visits to the farm.  There is parking assigned for vehicles that are in need of handicapped access a all park run facilities. There are also handicap accessible ramps available at the Plains High School Visitor Center and Museum and the Train Depot. The lower level of the Depot is accessible through the front door and the upper level is accessible by way of the handicap ramp. All of the buildings at the Boyhood Farm are handicapped accessible by way of ramp or direct entry.
